newsitem.title: USA: Lee Enterprises to sell unit for $55 mln.
newsitem.headline: Lee Enterprises to sell unit for $55 mln.

text.p: Lee Enterprises Inc said Monday it signed a letter of intent to sell its graphic arts products subsidiary, NAPP Systems Inc, to Polyfibron Technologies Inc of Billerica, Mass., for $55 milion.
NAPP, based in San Marcos, Calif., makes and distributes photopolymer printing plates and plate processing systems throughout the world.
The transaction, which is subject to regulatory approval, is expected to close by December 31.
Lee said the sale will permit it to concentrate on its core media businesses.
"The proceeds will be available for Lee stock repurchases or other investment as appropriate," Richard Gottlieb, president, said in a statement.
